alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 29 at 4:00AM PST until December 02 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THURSDAY TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 4000 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 4000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 24 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades above 4000 feet elevation from near highway 140 northward. This includes Crater Lake, Lake of the Woods, and Diamond Lake Junction. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM Thursday to 4 AM PST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Thursday night through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow accumulation will primarily fall in two rounds Thursday into Thursday evening and late Friday morning through Saturday. Snow accumulations could continue Saturday night for elevations above 5000 feet and into Sunday for elevations above 6000 feet. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
